@@ -8,17 +8,35 @@ cp app/app/local.env app/app/.env
 
 ## Startup server
 
+*Check that you have Docker and Docker-compose properly installed*
+```shell
+docker --version
+Docker version 18.09.7, build 2d0083d
+
+docker-compose --version
+docker-compose version 1.24.1, build 4667896b
+```
+The above should work.
+
 ### Running in Detached mode
 
 ```shell
 docker-compose up -d --build
 ```
 
+The above would create a background daemon when it finished installation. It takes pretty long time, an hour or more. The good news is that it runs on its own. If you have error while running this it is likely to come from docker and docker-compose.
+
 ### Running in the foreground
 
 ```shell
 docker-compose up --build
 ```
+### Screens during building
+
+![alt text](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/janus/web/janus_doc/docs/imgs/screenshot1.png "Installation screenshot")

body: [On line 7](https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/e4ac43b3e19983941c2ed0595c7971598b37c475/app/dashboard/templates/ens/base.html#L7) we include the `shared/head.html`. The `shared/head.html` includes for its part the [shared/favicon.html](https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/a6d073c3c8a3be999269e1ae0b390b13ff2cb814/app/retail/templates/shared/head.html#L75). So we don't need it twice.

@@ -5,32 +5,17 @@
     <title>{% trans "ENS Subdomains | Gitcoin" %}</title>
     {% include 'shared/cards_pic.html' with title='Gitcoin | _you_.gitcoin.eth ENS Subdomains'  card_desc='*NEW* Register `_you_.gitcoin.eth` with one click for free' avatar_url="https://s.gitcoin.co/static/v2/images/ens_gitcoin.png"  %}
     {% include 'shared/head.html' %}
-    <meta charset="utf-8" />
-    <meta name="title" content="ENS Subdomains | Gitcoin">

-    <!--[if lte IE 8]><script src="{% static "onepager/js/html5shiv.js" %}"></script><![endif]-->
-    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static "v2/css/bootstrap.min.css" %}" crossorigin="anonymous">
+
     <link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static "v2/css/kudos/styles.css" %}" />

-    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static "v2/css/lib/typography.css" %}">

-    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static "onepager/css/main.css" %}">
body:
`v2/css/lib/typography.css`
Already included in https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/a6d073c3c8a3be999269e1ae0b390b13ff2cb814/app/retail/templates/shared/head.html#L36

`v2/css/gitcoin.css`
Already included in https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/a6d073c3c8a3be999269e1ae0b390b13ff2cb814/app/retail/templates/shared/head.html#L38

`onepager/css/main.css`
The file is included twice, so I removed it once:

1. https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/e8956ddd478e5aca3b3b4a134b40d0c6368d6f75/app/dashboard/templates/ens/base.html#L16
2. https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/e8956ddd478e5aca3b3b4a134b40d0c6368d6f75/app/dashboard/templates/ens/base.html#L19
The async attribute is only for external scripts (and should only be used if the src attribute is present). https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_script_async.asp

Multiple reasons:
* This file `cards.html` should be used only for social media meta data, not for page properties
* The meta description will be set already in https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/f6e5b1e56ffd65945e517427a6b072b2c22c3ecc/app/retail/templates/shared/head.html#L78 The W3C validator reports the double output of meta description, see https://validator.w3.org/nu/?doc=https%3A%2F%2Fgitcoin.co%2F

Actually yes, but I have based myself on existing webpages:

https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/6505bd5e4e67320deee0d28f64dee180b857cde5/app/dashboard/templates/bounty/increase.html#L162-L192
https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/6505bd5e4e67320deee0d28f64dee180b857cde5/app/grants/templates/grants/cancel.html#L107-L125
https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/blob/6505bd5e4e67320deee0d28f64dee180b857cde5/app/grants/templates/grants/fund.html#L355-L385
Okay, but a page meta description is wrong place in `cards.html` file. The better way would to create a `shared/meta.html` with page meta informations and include the file everywhere.
I don't found any Gitcoin page without meta description generated by `web/app/retail/templates/shared/head.html`. You?

@@ -0,0 +1,63 @@
+# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
+'''
+    Copyright (C) 2018 Gitcoin Core
+
+    This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
+    it under the terms of the GNU Affero General Public License as published
+    by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
+    (at your option) any later version.
+
+    This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
+    but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
+    MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
+    GNU Affero General Public License for more details.
+
+    You should have received a copy of the GNU Affero General Public License
+    along with this program. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
+
+'''
+from datetime import datetime
+
+from django.core.management.base import BaseCommand
+from django.utils import timezone
+
+from marketing.mails import nth_day_email_campaign
+from marketing.models import EmailSubscriber
+
+
+def n_days_ago(n):
+    before = timezone.now() - timezone.timedelta(days=n)
+    return datetime(
+        before.year, before.month, before.day,
+        0, 0, 0, 0,
+        tzinfo=timezone.get_current_timezone())
+
+
+def send_nth_email_to_subscriber(nth, sub):
+    first_email = EmailSubscriber.objects.filter(email__iexact=sub.email).order_by('created_on').first()
+    if first_email.id == sub.id:
+        # it is the first time this subscriber is in our system
+        # send email to him/her
+        nth_day_email_campaign(nth, sub)
+
+
+def send_nth_email(nth):
+    print('sending day {} email'.format(nth))
+    # query all new subscribers created
+    # may contain duplicated email addresses with different source
+    subs = EmailSubscriber.objects.filter(
+        created_on__gt=n_days_ago(nth),
+        created_on__lte=n_days_ago(nth-1))
+    for sub in subs:
+        send_nth_email_to_subscriber(nth, sub)
+
+
+class Command(BaseCommand):
+
+    help = 'Send marketing email to new subscribers'
+
+    def handle(self, *args, **options):
body:
I simply run this command once and it looks ok.
There are other commands from this repo, you need to schedule this one just like the others

-def web3_process_bounty(bounty_data):
+def web3_process_bounty(bounty_data, dry_run=False):
     did_change, old_bounty, new_bounty = process_bounty_details(bounty_data)

body:
correct, the idea is to use `sync_geth` command to call `process_bounty_changes()` only.

to make code clear, i could update `sync_web3()` using `process_bounty_details()` instead of `web3_process_bounty()`

Think about the situation that user close browser after submitting his work. Email is sent not through `sync_web3()`, but `sync_geth` command

+# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
+'''

+    MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
+    GNU Affero General Public License for more details.
+
+    You should have received a copy of the GNU Affero General Public License
+    along with this program. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
+
+'''
+from datetime import datetime
+
+from django.core.management.base import BaseCommand
+from django.utils import timezone
+
+from marketing.mails import nth_day_email_campaign
+from marketing.models import EmailSubscriber
+
+
+def n_days_ago(n):
+    before = timezone.now() - timezone.timedelta(days=n)
+    return datetime(
+        before.year, before.month, before.day,
+        0, 0, 0, 0,
+        tzinfo=timezone.get_current_timezone())
+
+
+def send_nth_email_to_subscriber(nth, sub):
+    first_email = EmailSubscriber.objects.filter(email__iexact=sub.email).order_by('created_on').first()
+    if first_email.id == sub.id:
+        # it is the first time this subscriber is in our system
+        # send email to him/her
+        nth_day_email_campaign(nth, sub)
+
+
+def send_nth_email(nth):
+    print('sending day {} email'.format(nth))
+    # query all new subscribers created
+    # may contain duplicated email addresses with different source
+    subs = EmailSubscriber.objects.filter(
+        created_on__gt=n_days_ago(nth),
+        created_on__lte=n_days_ago(nth-1))
+    for sub in subs:
+        send_nth_email_to_subscriber(nth, sub)
+
+
+class Command(BaseCommand):
+
+    help = 'Send marketing email to new subscribers'
+
+    def handle(self, *args, **options):

body:
What does tie to your Gitcoin account mean? Can we be more clear?

Let's use:
By clicking delete, all of your data will be removed from Gitcoin. We are unable to delete your data from the Ethereum blockchain.

cc:@vs77bb
